channel.title: Two Ring Software RSS
channel.description: All updates from Two Ring Software.

item.title: Advent of Code 2020 on Swift Playgrounds for iPad
item.description: I tried using the Swift Playgrounds app on my iPad while solving problems for Advent of Code 2020 this year. Here's my impression of the app as a code editor.

item.title: My WWDC 2019 Session Watchlist
item.description: My scheduled programming for watching this year's WWDC session videos.

item.title: Good Morning, iOS!
item.description: Brainstorming ways to combine Apple's productivity apps into a bird's-eye-view Today widget: Good Morning!

item.title: Tag Everything
item.description: A small request for sharing some simple organizational features amongst more of Apple's productivity apps, with some mockups of what it might look like in Reminders and Calendar.

item.title: Interpreting Apple's Transparency Report
item.description: Apple recently released their transparency report for government and private party information requests for January through June of 2018, in an updated format including broken out CSVs.

item.title: New Year, New Task Management
item.description: Describing the setup I've put in place towards a New Year's resolution to manage my time a little better, both for the day-to-day and longer-running goals.

item.title: Fun with Unicode in Swift
item.description: Looking at some ways to write tricky Swift code using Unicode.

item.title: Developer CLI tool reference
item.description: A collection of command line tools I've used on *nix systems.

item.title: Swift Async Operations at Your Command
item.description: Rewriting an old asynchronous Operation (n√©e NSOperation) subclass in Swift for Pippin, learning new things.

item.title: On a Mission to Automate Revision
item.description: Introducing a new tool as part of my evolution towards effortless versioning of code.

item.title: Backend to Basics
item.description: Catching up on some experimentation with different backend, one of which was the Vapor framework for Swift on the server.

item.title: New command line tools
item.description: Announcing some new CLI tools available, and plans on how to consolidate others like psst, xcbs and vrsn.

item.title: My holy grail: a simple Rails install
item.description: Describing yet another winding foray into setting up a Rails app.

item.title: do try Antitypical's Result to catch Async Errors in Swift
item.description: Reviewing my foray into using Result for error handling in Swift, and my realization of a particular use case it solves well.

item.title: Overusing Xcode Targets Misses the Mark
item.description: Outlining the differences between Xcode project targets and build configurations, and how to properly use each one.

item.title: Automatic Devpod Versioning and Deployment with Vrsnr
item.description: Describing my process for semantically versioning the Pippin podspec, deploying it to CocoaPods trunk, and committing all the results to git history.

item.title: Reach Out and Touch Faith
item.description: Thinking about the future of the Macbook Pro, and the direction in which the TouchBar might indicate it's headed.

item.title: CocoaPods and Custom Build Configurations
item.description: My long journey to set a devpod's SWIFT_OPTIMIZATION_LEVEL, from the podspec's pods_target_xcconfig, to Podfile's post_install and finally arriving at the succinct project.

item.title: Programming: 20 Years In
item.description: As I near 20 years since first picking up computer programming, I take a quick look back at the languages I've used and the tools available to work with them, with thoughts on the synergies between them and our own brains.

item.title: Dependency Management Best Practices
item.description: In light of recent news about dependency manager breakages and vulnerabilities, highlighting some steps you can take to protect your dependencies and the projects for which you need them.

item.title: Announcing Pippin Version 2
item.description: Highlighting some of the new features in the first major update to Pippin.

item.title: Manage version numbers with this one line command
item.description: How I'm currently using Rake to automate a few common tasks I carry out to manage my iOS apps' version numbers.

item.title: Introducing Pippin
item.description: An update and first official version of my Swift app development framework.

item.title: Introducing Psst
item.description: A simple script to perform straigtforward template replacement of credentials in a codebase, to help avoid committing them.

item.title: Image Galleries with Jekyll
item.description: Describing my journey to build a photo gallery for my website using Jekyll/Liquid to template all the things.

item.title: Log Level: Extreme
item.description: A brief survey of log level concepts in the iOS community and elsewhere.

item.title: Apple's Tech Evolutions
item.description: Extrapolating Apple's technological advances from the past onto their current product lines and research, for funsies.

item.title: Looms and Computers
item.description: The similarities between computers and looms, distant cousins related through their ancestor, the Jacquard loom.

item.title: Xcode 9's New Find and Replace Panel
item.description: A critique of the new source editors tool's UI and UX.

item.title: Returning Optionals Versus Throwing Errors in Swift
item.description: Deciding between flow control and data model concepts in your app's business logic.

item.title: Source Control Management vs. Dependency Management
item.description: Which manager has more authority over your project?

item.title: Differentiating iOS App Builds
item.description: A simple way to manage all your app build variants to test alongside each other on a device.

item.title: Validating Crash Reporting in Live iOS Apps
item.description: There's only one way to guarantee your iOS crash reporter is working: purposefully crash your app in production.

item.title: Snapping Angles and Fuzzy Binary Search
item.description: Implementing a variant of the binary search algorithm to find nearest interval angles on the unit circle.

item.title: Objective-C Block Syntax
item.description: Some ways to make writing Objective-C blocks in Xcode a little easier.

item.title: Tracking Xcode Build Setting Changes with xcbs
item.description: Announcing a small CLI for persisting final Xcode project build settings in lockfiles.

item.title: Xcode Build Setting Inheritance and Precedence
item.description: Straightening out the tangled web of relationships in the world of Xcode build configuration.

item.title: The Art of Source Control, Part 2: Clean Git History
item.description: Outlining some best practices concerning git history tidiness.

item.title: The Art of Source Control, Part 1: Organizing Codebases
item.description: Outlining some best practices for organizing a codebase.

item.title: Passwords
item.description: Anecdata regarding antipatterns in the realm of password management for your service's users.

item.title: Going Back to the Future to test with git-rebase
item.description: Adventures in Git, using rebase to reorder history and automate some testing, too!

item.title: Making the site a little more SASSy
item.description: Why I decided to use SASS to manage the site's CSS.
